page.title: 03Interesting People
page.content: We interviewed our school cleaner, who first came to Compton when the railwayfrom Didcot to Southampton was still running .When she came to the school they had four classes and teachers.She had reading writing and arithmetic lessons and also learnt knitting and sewing. We have more play space now,but then there were separate playgrounds for girls and boys. When the bell rang at 08.55 they had hymn singing.In the two hour lunch time most pupils went home.School ended at 16.30.The classrooms were lit by oil lamps and heated by solid fuel stoves.They had no running water, and had to fetch water from the well in the Schoolhouse garden.She thinks that on the whole Compton has become a better place over the year.
